title: Welcome to ROKS 2013

author: Johan Suykens, Department of Electrical Engineering, KU Leuven
category: Top->Computer Science->Machine Learning->Kernel Methods->Support Vector Machines

segmentation: Good afternoon everybody.
All very welcome to the International Workshop ROX, 2013.
Here in love in Belgium.
I wish you also welcome on behalf of the other organizing committee members you will see.
Several of them here.
During the next few days on rails.
Chris Moritz Christian, Marko Vanya and yours.
In fact.
Let me first tell a bit about the main scope of this workshop.
And so we all know that.
Material areas these days are.
Kernel methods and support vector machines.
There has been a lot of research and fascinating results in this direction.
On the other hand, in recent years there has also been.
A lot of deep impacts by the methods of compressed sensing and sparsity.
Another important Ave is convex optimization.
Both support vector machines, kernel methods and compressed sensing.
They both share some convex optimization problems.
So the question is what is the?
Next big thing for the for the coming year, so I hope that in the next few days we will have many experts.
Researchers giving talks here that we will be able to see the light for the future that we can find some new synergies there between each of these established areas.
Also in a very multidisciplinary spirit, we have experts here of machine learning, statistics, optimization, partner recognition.
We have experts in theory and applications, so the idea is to.
Really have open discussions.
With a lot of fascinating new outcomes, hopefully.
So this scope is also written in the acronym of this workshop.
Rocks or stands for regularization or optimization.
Then we have K kernel methods and as support vector machines.
So this is among the main team.
But it's of course not limited to this scope, but this is the main emphasis I would say.
So we have a lot of plenary speakers during these three days.
Today we are very happy to welcome speaker surgeons Charlotte Taylor Martin Jacquian later on today, Bernard Scholkopf.
For tomorrow.
Francis back, Stephen Boyd, and it's actually a miracle that Steven is here today.
Becausw, we all know that in San Francisco this terrible plane crash happened, but.
Steven is an expert in optimization in knows how to arrive in time.
Then we have also just in Rome.
Berikan Massey Pontil and on the log.
Today last but not least, I would say Yuri Nesterov visual drop things.
So on Zuan James Clock.
So in addition, we have 5 oral sessions.
One on feature selection today.
Tomorrow optimization algorithms and kernel methods, and on Wednesday structured approximation and robustness.
There are also two poster sessions tomorrow.
We will also have spotlight presentations, so every presenter gets 2 minutes in addition with the short one slide key message presentation to give us the main ID of the.
Of the work.

So you have received by now the hard copy book of abstracts, but this is currently also on the website, so if you like you can also download the complete PDF of this book of abstracts and on this website you can also download per contribution the PDF with the extended abstract.
So this is made available this morning.
So there is also wireless Internet access here.
You have got a personal code for this, so this code has been individual provided so you also have received one Patch information on this from the registration desk.
So this auditorium, an automatic Castle will be the main site for this workshop, so the all the lectures will be taking place here, including the spotlight presentations of the posters.
The coffee breaks later onto there we will have the welcome reception.
Tomorrow and on Wednesday.

The poster sessions will take place in rooms S so you also have some Maps in the back of your book of abstracts indicating the location and also the lunch will be close to this rooms as it will be in the motor and then the dinner tomorrow evening will be in the faculty club.
It's about 20 minutes walking from here but the weather will be excellent in the next few days so it will be a refreshing work.
You will not have to sit all day long here in the auditorium.
From time to time you can take a nice walk.
So I also want to say special thanks to the European Research Council becausw.
This workshop has been organized within the framework of a knee or see advanced grants a data drive B.
So we are grateful for the.
Financial support
So finally I would say let it rocks and I give the work now to one of the other members of the organizing Committee, Christian Public Malls.
Thank you.
